target.alt: Target icon for purpose or goal

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used in Purpose sections to indicate goals or objectives.

gear.alt: Gear icon for features or configuration

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Highlights module features or system configurations.

plug.alt: Plug icon for integrations or connections

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Shows which systems or data streams are connected to a module.

megaphone.alt: Megaphone icon for announcements or bulletins

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used for internal bulletins or urgent messages.

clipboard.alt: Clipboard icon for workflows or lists

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents steps or bullet point lists in module workflows.

brain.alt: Brain icon for intelligence or AI-related tasks

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Marks smart task input powered by AI.

bolt.alt: Bolt icon for rapid or powerful actions

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents powerful or immediate actions like triggers.

lightbulb.alt: Lightbulb icon for ideas or examples

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used for tips, ideas, or learning examples in reports.

rocket.alt: Rocket icon for improvements or enhancements

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Highlights planned upgrades or future features.

trophy.alt: Trophy icon for achievements or importance

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Indicates high-value or strategic initiatives.

folder.alt: Folder icon for management or organization

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents organized tracking of permit documents.

clock.alt: Clock icon for timing or scheduling

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents time-based calculations and schedules.

warning.alt: Warning icon for exclusions or alerts

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used to warn about excluded dates like holidays.
Represents finance-related modules like billing and POs.

puzzle.alt: Puzzle piece icon for modular components

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Indicates different system parts or modules.

barChart.alt: Bar chart icon for analytics or dashboards

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents data visualization or performance metrics.

shield.alt: Shield icon for security or controls

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Highlights security or approval gate features.

tools.alt: Tools icon for service or maintenance

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used for modules related to field service and repairs.

bookBlue.alt: Blue book icon for glossaries or structured knowledge

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents glossary and reference documents.

bookOpen.alt: Open book icon for content tables or references

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Indicates lists of defined terms or reference material.

link.alt: Link icon for shared references or connections

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Indicates pointer relationships or connected data.
Used for governance and constitutional rules.

ruler.alt: Ruler icon for rules or standards

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents strict rule sets or behavior standards.

document.alt: Document icon for pages or structure

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents sections like headers, body, and footers.

upArrow.alt: Arrow up icon for headers or top sections

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Indicates header rules or top-of-page content.

downArrow.alt: Arrow down icon for footers or bottom sections

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Indicates footer rules or bottom-of-page content.

palette.alt: Palette icon for styling or visual themes

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents design, color, or visual rules.

receipt.alt: Receipt icon for metadata or tracking

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Indicates logging or data-tracking fields.

calendar.alt: Calendar icon for scheduling or date/time

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used to highlight dates and scheduling actions.

scales.alt: Scales icon representing balance, fairness, or guiding principles

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used to visually represent the core guiding principles of the Skyesoft Constitution.

compass.alt: Compass icon for guidance or direction

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents guiding principles like those in the 7 Habits framework.

database.alt: Database icon representing structured data and storage

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used to indicate foundational data objects like entities, locations, contacts, and orders.

table.alt: Table icon for displaying structured data in rows and columns

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used to visually indicate sections that render tabular data like principles, core data objects, or glossary terms.

user.alt: User icon representing a person, profile, or system participant

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used to visually indicate human roles such as users, managers, developers, or administrators.

users.alt: Users icon representing groups of people, teams, or collaborative roles

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used to indicate sections that describe multiple human roles such as users, managers, developers, and administrators working together in the Skyesoft system.

shieldBlue.alt: Shield icon representing protection, security, and compliance

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used to indicate sections dealing with data security, privacy policies, or user protection rules.

pen.alt: Pen icon representing writing, editing, or amendments

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used to visually indicate processes related to constitutional or document amendments within Skyesoft.

information.alt: Information icon representing glossary and help sections

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Used for glossary sections or informational content.

book.alt: Book icon for sources of truth

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents foundational sources of truth such as operational streams, knowledge bases, and archives.
Represents AI assistant functions like Skyebot.

code.alt: Code icon for technical snippets or structured examples

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents JSON, API calls, or structured code examples in documentation.

mobilePhone.alt: Mobile phone icon for smartphone or device interactions

sampleUsage.exampleContext: Represents mobile device interactions, mobile modals, or smartphone-based inputs like punch-in/out.
